page.title: 18Menwith "Town"- Kettlesing
page.content: A large portion of U.S. families associated with Menwith Hill Station live within its precincts, on a large housing estate, served by multiple amenities available for all U.S. station personnel and their dependents and some, also, for use by British personnel. A U.S. school for ages 5-14 has approx. 100 pupils. A non-denomina- tional chapel serves Christians and Jews. There is an extensive range of entertainment and recreational facilities comprising a children's playground, golf course, gymnasia, fast food restaurant and library. Retail outlets include a supermarket, department store, and petrol station. There are a thriving number of clubs and societies covering every range of activity and interest, holding en- tertainments and fund-raising events.
